Pre-Game Insights: Sports betting analyst Josh Inglis handicaps the three known LDS matchups, including why he likes the Padres over the Dodgers, and why he loves the under-valued Guardians to put a stop to the Tigers' Cinderella run.
The Tigers are fresh off slaying an October behemoth in their sweep of the Houston Astros and will look to continue their improbable run.
The Guardians and their imposing bullpen are well-rested with what will be nearly a week between games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers won the season series, 7-6.
The Guardians won the season series, 7-6 (Total score of 50-60).
The Tigers are 24th in baseball with 162 homers and only one of their eight runs in the wild-card series came as a result of the long ball.
Since June 1, the Guardians rank 27th in baseball in runs scored, ahead of only the Los Angeles Angels, Tampa Bay Rays and Chicago White Sox.
The club’s OPS since that date is a paltry.695.
The Tigers’ bullpen was by far the best in baseball with a 2.57 ERA.
For context, the next best in the AL was the Tigers’ pen, which posted an ERA that was almost a full run higher (3.55).
Closer Emmanuel Clase is enjoying a season for the ages while Canadian rookie Cade Smith has been a revelation at the back end.
Others: The ALDS matchup features two clubs that are inherently familiar with each other.
The Tigers are looking to continue their improbable run.
The Guardians have an imposing bullpen.
The managers, Hinch and Vogt, will play a key role in the series.
